So this transparency cuts off other transparent objects behind it. This works well with the ground because the same colour is behind it. The grid does get cut off but it's less important.

This method probably won't work with multiple transparent effects going at once close together. If that's needed later on I have some other options to try
Yup, that works
With the ability to move it, we can always just place it slightly above ground level in director as well
Na, that looks alright.

This shadow effect sometimes gets hidden because the grid has lots of transparent objects in the way, but it's fine when you hide the grid. Although it should be fixed for  director, for the time being, this shouldn't be a problem for the iOS app right?
<http://lohit.dev.8i.com/d/>
Cool
Yep, that's how i'm doing it
but for now having seperate object will probably be easier/possible
Sure
I think we should go with 1 object per effect for now, I still need to rethink the way the timeline works
That would be great
Thought about those ground effects for our assets, and I reckon I can get a simple shadow and water ripple effect done today
Hmm, good point, I think we can probably do the timeline a bit better, have to consider how we should do it for animations and effects.
- Or start the animation on the objects 1st keyframe where the starting keyframe can be changed. This would mean every animation re-trigger would need another effect object

Here's a muzzle flash effect: <http://lohit.dev.8i.com/d/>

For this one, we have to decide on how to re-trigger its animation. I had a couple of ideas:
- Let the user put down keyframes and restart its animation on each keyframe

Hey, I'm getting an Internal Server Error on <http://lohit.dev.8i.com|lohit.dev.8i.com>.
Not sure how to decipher this http.log error:

Been thinking about rotation snapping. Right now we're rotating around global axes.  We're snapping the angle for each rotate operation. However, we're not snapping the rotation data (quaternion, or euler (XYZ) rotation). This means that after a bunch of rotations, you may not be able to get back to the starting (0,0,0) rotation.

I've just done a test to see if we can snap the euler angle after rotating the quaternion. It's very glitchy. You end up running into the same mathematical problems where euler angles don't uniquely match a quaternion. Looked into other people's attempts at this and they have no solutions. 

I reckon we should keep this but, in future, let the user turn off snapping, and allow for manual editing of the XYZ rotation.
Yea, I’m not really sure how we are going to use that just yet. It doesn’t look like I can invite anyone. I’ll get Tom to add you.
BTW not sure how to access the Atlassian Jira tracking. Do I need to be invited (if you want me to keep an eye on it)?
Cool. Will merge then
and just updating those quaternion values is a pretty safe change
Doesn’t matter too much as long as you are fairly confident you aren’t going to break anything else
Did you want the test to be run again before I merge in?
doh, I was thinking too hard about it. thanks
Yea, that should be the correct one
Oh... I get it now. I can just copy and paste the quaternion from the log, since I know it works correctly?

As I've told Asher:
I've opted with a vertical mouse movement control, so that it's as easy to scale up as it is to scale down.
I thought it'd be more intuitive to scale based on whether you move the mouse toward or away from the object. This was hard with this center cube since it's small and there's not much room to move the mouse toward its center, therefore, it would need a more meaningfully designed object to represent it.

Hey, just another thing about the OBJTool that isn't obvious: 
The OBJObject and OBJHelper/Handle objects have functions like: Select, Deselect, Activate, Deactivate. These only change the colour and they don't modify the OBJObjects in any way. This was again to keep all editing functionality in one place in OBJTool.
